Calcium is required to support the proper functioning of muscles, heart rhythm and more. It maintains blood pressure, regulates blood clotting and prevents certain cancers. When body lacks calcium diseases like osteoporosis, rickets etc are caused. Causes of calcium deficiency include malnutrition, malabsorption i.e. when body does not absorb the minerals needed from the food consumed. Women should consume around 1500mg of calcium during and after the menopause. Osteoporosis causes the bones to become brittle because of bone loss.
